alert.note: Alert for Cecil (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 10 at 1:05AM EST until January 10 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Two to three feet of inundation above ground level in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in Cecil County. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 6.1 feet, flooding begins along Back Creek in Chesapeake City, Elk River near Courthouse Point, Hollywood Beach and Port Herman, and along Bohemia River near Town Point. At 6.0 feet, widespread shoreline inundation occurs near Charlestown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides up to 6 feet above normal. The next high tide at Port Deposit is at 8:22 AM. The next high tide at Chesapeake City is at 9:26 AM. The next high tide at Charlestown is at 8:50 AM.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
